title: LoL recording software?
body:
Hey guys. I'm just here to ask about a good software to use to record my gameplay. I think I've sort of hit a wall in improving my gameplay, and I think that watching me play a game and picking out things I'm doing wrong will help me improve. So far, I've tried OBS and LoLreplay, but neither work effectively. OBS doesn't make videos to a good enough quality to for me to critically analyse, and LoLreplay simply doesn't want to work. Any other software out there that can help me? 

Also, if you know one that can somehow record it like it is in spectator mode, that would be brilliant. However, it isn't that necessary. 

Thanks guys :)

replies.body: I'm using www.replay.gg and thats worked really well for me.
Its really good, since if your team is trash you can watch them feed over and over again :D
way more productive if you just analyse your own mistakes and improve with each game. no point getting your jimmies rustled by things you cant control.

This might come out sounding wrong but, what you there was nothing you can do to improve. Since most of the time i'm paired with the most toxic players who do nothing but feed and flame. I try my best every game and 50/50 chance i end up carrying them, yes i know people have bad games etc or they are just bad ( i understand that) but the people I get paired with have some sort of brain damage and don't know where Q or Right Click on their keyboard or mouse....

Here is a picture from my last game

http://imgur.com/lyAAfHI

I get the frustration man. There are definitely games where all seems lost and there nothing you could have done. But I honestly believe unless you are top 50 player challenger there is ALWAYS something you could have done better. Even within the first 10 minutes we all make a tonne of mistakes, the most common being not capitalizing on enemy mistakes. Every player makes mistakes early in lane once in a while and challenger players easily capitalize and get kills/build leads.

I would highly suggest watching this series by one of our local uni clubs UNSW - https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL9RdXhXESRJzgY_SwHB8T-cZxXljWhQvz

2 Months ago I had a bad stretch and TL:DR - I went like 1 - 17 dropped heaps. I wanted to point out that in each of these games it was easy for me to point and blame team mates for the loss and just leave it at that. But after each game it was possible for me to review and learn something, this meant that even though I was frustrated and tilted and depressed I was still (hopefully) improving and learning after each game. When I go through this I always think about how this is only 11 games out of 524.

Don't get me wrong, I'm not saying every loss is on you and every win is on you. But every single game I guarantee unless you're faker you can learn and improve. If you can find joy in playing the game and improving and not just winning then you will find not only do you enjoy League of Legends more but you will actually win more in the long run!

Hope this helps man, GL HF on the Rift

Thanks for all your comments guys. I'll have a look and see which one I like.
overwolf has everything you need, even a death recap where it shows you where you went wrong after you die

I use 3 recording softwares, BaronReplay and Op.gg, and AMD Gaming Evolved (Raptr) (the last one actually shows your mouse clicks and where you were looking at the time, but it does use up a lot of space.

I've recently started to use LoL Summoner Information 

http://www.leaguelsi.com/

Records all of your games so you can replay them later on at your leisure.

ScreenFlow is Extremely Useful (works for PC and Mac) but does cost a fair bit of Money

If You want something free EzVid is good and is convenient to use (Only Works on Windows)
